intro: Triolena auriculata, commonly known as the auriculate triolena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, auriculate (ear-shaped) leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a contrasting yellow or orange throat. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Triolena auriculata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in warm climates.
